required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Descriptive, Post-marketing, Surveillance Safety Study of Menactra Vaccine
clinical_study.official_title: Post-licensure Safety Surveillance Study of Routine Use of Meningococcal (Groups A, C, Y, and W-135) Polysaccharide Diphtheria Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine (Menactra ™)

brief_summary.textblock: To further characterize the safety profile of Menactra vaccine and to identify any signals of potentially vaccine-related adverse events (AEs) not detected during pre-licensure studies.

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Diagnoses With Significantly Elevated Findings From Risk-Window vs. Control-Window Comparisons: All Ages Combined - Short-Term Passive Surveillance
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rates for each diagnosis were calculated as the number of events divided by person-time and expressed as events per 1,000 person-months in each 30-day comparison window. Individuals receiving Menactra vaccine served as their own controls for evaluation of acute (Days 0-30) events. Rates of events occurring during Days 0-30 following vaccination were compared to rates of events occurring during Days 31-60 following vaccination. Clinical setting is given in parenthesis as either (H) for hospital or (ER) for emergency room.

other_outcome.measure: Summary of Diagnoses With Significantly Elevated Findings for Menactra Vaccine Recipients vs. Age-Matched Controls - All Ages Combined - Long-Term Passive Surveillance
other_outcome.description: Incidence rates for each diagnosis were calculated as the number of events divided by person-time and expressed as events per 1,000 person-months in the 6-month surveillance period. For each individual receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a vaccination during the same month 1 year earlier. Rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination with Menactra vaccine were compared to rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination in age-matched controls. Clinical setting is given in parenthesis as either (H) for hospital or (ER) for emergency room.

other_outcome.measure: Summary of Diagnoses With Significantly Elevated Findings From Risk-Window vs. Control-Window Comparisons - By Age Categories - Short-Term Passive Surveillance
other_outcome.description: Incidence rates for each diagnosis were calculated as the number of events divided by person-time and expressed as events per 1,000 person-months for each 30-day comparison window. Individuals receiving Menactra vaccine served as their own controls for evaluation of acute (Days 0-30) events. Rates of events occurring during Days 0-30 following vaccination were compared to rates of events occurring during Days 31-60 following vaccination. Clinical setting is given in parenthesis as either (H) for hospital or (ER) for emergency room.

other_outcome.measure: Summary of Diagnoses With Significantly Elevated Findings for Menactra Vaccine Recipients vs. Age-Matched Controls - By Age Categories - Long-Term Passive Surveillance
other_outcome.description: Incidence rates for each diagnosis were calculated as the number of events divided by person-time and expressed as events per 1,000 person-months in the 6-month surveillance period. For each individual receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a vaccination during the same month 1 year earlier. Rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination with Menactra vaccine were compared to rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination in age-matched controls. Clinical setting is given in parenthesis as (C) for pre-specified adverse events, (H) for hospital, (ER) for emergency room.

other_outcome.measure: Summary of Diagnoses With Significantly Reduced Findings for Menactra Vaccine Recipients vs. Age-Matched Controls - All Ages Combined - Long-Term Passive Surveillance
other_outcome.description: Incidence rates for each diagnosis were calculated as the number of events divided by person-time and expressed as events per 1,000 person-months in the 6-month surveillance period. For each individual receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a vaccination during the same month 1 year earlier. Rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination with Menactra vaccine were compared to rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination in age-matched controls. Clinical setting is given in parenthesis as either (H) for hospital or (ER) for emergency room.

other_outcome.measure: Summary of Diagnoses With Significantly Reduced Findings for Menactra Vaccine Recipients vs. Age-Matched Controls - By Age Categories - Long-Term Passive Surveillance
other_outcome.description: Incidence rates for each diagnosis were calculated as the number of events divided by person-time and expressed as events per 1,000 person-months in the 6-month surveillance period. For each individual receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a vaccination during the same month 1 year earlier. Rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination with Menactra vaccine were compared to rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination in age-matched controls. Clinical setting is given in parenthesis as either (H) for hospital or (ER) for emergency room.

other_outcome.measure: Rates of Serious Adverse Events Per 1000 Doses During 6 Months After Menactra Vaccination - ER Setting - All Ages Combined.
other_outcome.description: Only persons who received Menactra vaccine during the study period were surveyed and included in this outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Rates of Serious Adverse Events Per 1000 Doses at During 6 Months After Menactra Vaccination - Hospital Setting - All Ages Combined
other_outcome.description: Only persons who received Menactra vaccine during the study period were surveyed and included in this outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Summary of Reported Pregnancy Outcomes in Menactra Vaccine Recipients Pregnant at or Within 28 Days After Vaccination
other_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 up to Determination of Pregnancy Outcome
other_outcome.description: Only persons who received Menactra vaccine during the study period were included in this outcome.

arm_group.description: Participants who received Menactra vaccine as part of routine medical care during the study period in Kaiser Permanente.

Each individual receiving Menactra vaccine served as their own control for evaluation of acute (Days 0-30) events (short-term surveillance). For the 6-month (long-term) surveillance, for each person receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a received tetanus and diphtheria toxoids (Td), hepatitis A, hepatitis B, or hepatitis A/hepatitis B combination vaccine as part of routine medical care during the same month 1 year earlier in Kaiser Permanente

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Receipt of Menactra vaccine during the study period.
Exclusion Criteria:

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study participant accrual occurred from 15 July 2005 through 14 April 2006.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Databases were reviewed to identify persons who received Menactra vaccine within Kaiser Permanente and to identify all medical care events for the 6-month period following vaccination or, if applicable, through the end of pregnancy. Subjects served as their own control for 0-30 days surveillance, age-matched control served for the 6-month period.

group.title: Menactra Vaccine Recipients
group.description: Kaiser Permanente members who received Menactra vaccine during the study period. Kaiser Permanente databases were used; Menactra vaccine was administered according to routine clinical practice.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Each individual receiving Menactra vaccine served as their own control for evaluation of acute (Days 0–30) events (short-term surveillance). For the 6-month (long-term) surveillance, for each person receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a received tetanus and diphtheria toxoids (Td), hepatitis A, hepatitis B, or hepatitis A/hepatitis B combination vaccine during the same month 1 year earlier. Kaiser Permanente databases were used; Menactra and control vaccine were administered according to routine clinical practice.

baseline.population: Subjects who received Menactra vaccine during the study period from the Kaiser Permanente databases.

group.title: Menactra Vaccine Recipients
group.description: Kaiser Permanente members who received Menactra vaccine during the study period. Kaiser Permanente database was used as no study vaccine was provided or administered as part of this study.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Each individual receiving Menactra vaccine served as their own control for evaluation of acute (Days 0–30) events (short-term surveillance). For the 6-month (long-term) surveillance, for each person receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a received tetanus and diphtheria toxoids (Td), hepatitis A, hepatitis B, or hepatitis A/hepatitis B combination vaccine during the same month 1 year earlier. Kaiser Permanente database was used as no study vaccine was provided or administered as part of this study.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Gender information for 3 participants was not available in the database.

measure.title: Seasonality
measure.description: Data represents participants receiving vaccine each season or time period shown. Some participants (49) had received more than one dose of Menactra vaccine are counted for each dose in the seasonality section.

outcome.title: Summary of Diagnoses With Significantly Elevated Findings From Risk-Window vs. Control-Window Comparisons: All Ages Combined – Short-Term Passive Surveillance
outcome.description: Incidence rates for each diagnosis were calculated as the number of events divided by person-time and expressed as events per 1,000 person-months in each 30-day comparison window. Individuals receiving Menactra vaccine served as their own controls for evaluation of acute (Days 0–30) events. Rates of events occurring during Days 0–30 following vaccination were compared to rates of events occurring during Days 31–60 following vaccination. Clinical setting is given in parenthesis as either (H) for hospital or (ER) for emergency room.
outcome.population: All persons who received Menactra vaccine during the study period were included in the analysis.

group.title: Menactra Vaccine Recipients
group.description: Participants who received Menactra vaccine during the study period from the Kaiser Permanente databases. None administered in this study: N/A in this study

group.title: Control Group
group.description: The individuals receiving Menactra vaccine served as their own controls for evaluation of acute (Days 0–30) events. Rates of events occurring during Days 0–30 following vaccination were compared to rates of events occurring during Days 31–60 following vaccination. The 6-month surveillance: For each individual receiving Menactra vaccine, a control matched on age (± 1 year), sex, and month of vaccination was selected who received a vaccination1 during the same month 1 year earlier. Rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination with Menactra vaccine were compared to rates of events occurring during the 6 months following vaccination in the control individuals.

Pregnancy - Stillborn delivery post prolapsed cord

outcome.title: Summary of Reported Pregnancy Outcomes in Menactra Vaccine Recipients Pregnant at or Within 28 Days After Vaccination
outcome.description: Only persons who received Menactra vaccine during the study period were included in this outcome.
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 up to Determination of Pregnancy Outcome
outcome.population: Only persons who received Menactra vaccine during the study period were included in the analysis. There were no control group analysis because the threshold of 25 pregnancies with known were not achieved at the time the surveillance was concluded.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events data surveillance period was from the day of vaccination up to 6 months post-vaccination from the Hospital database.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor must have the opportunity to review at least 60 days prior to submission for publication or presentation. If review indicates that potentially patentable subject matter would be disclosed, publication or public disclosure may be delayed for a maximum of an additional 60 days to allow for filing the necessary patent applications.
